title: Sources: Celtics trading Holiday to Trail Blazers
content: The Celtics are trading Jrue Holiday to the Trail Blazers for Anfernee Simons and two second-round draft picks, sources told ESPN on Monday night.

title: Sources: Knicks interviewing Wolves coach Nori
content: Timberwolves assistant coach Micah Nori is the third to formally interview with the Knicks for their head coaching job, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania on Tuesday.

title: Comedian Gillis chosen to host ESPYS on July 16
content: Comedian Shane Gillis will celebrate the achievements, athletes and moments in sports from the past year as host of the ESPYS in July, it was announced.

title: Haliburton on playing injured: 'I'd do it again'
content: Indiana Pacers star Tyrese Haliburton said he didn't regret playing through a calf strain that led to a torn right Achilles tendon in Game 7.

title: Tatis sues company to void future earnings deal
content: Padres star Fernando Tatis Jr. filed a lawsuit Monday against Big League Advance in an attempt to void the future earnings contract he signed as a 17-year-old minor leaguer that could cost him $34 million.

title: Raleigh hits MLB-leading 32nd HR in Mariners' win
content: Seattle star catcher Cal Raleigh, 28, hit his major-league-leading 32nd home run in the ninth inning of the Mariners' 11-2 victory over the Minnesota Twins on Monday night, just a few hours after being chosen the American League player of the week.

title: Miami's unbeaten run sets up CWC clash with PSG
content: Palmeiras came from behind to draw 2-2 with host Inter Miami at Hard Rock Stadium on Monday night, with both clubs advancing to the Club World Cup round of 16 and setting up a matchup between Miami and Paris Saint-Germain.

title: The 'abrupt reversal of fortune' that changed everything for Cooper Flagg and the Mavs
content: The presumptive No. 1 pick of the 2025 draft and the organization, still reeling from trading away Luka Doncic, might just be made for each other -- at exactly the right time.

title: Bilas: Eight prospects who stand out in this year's NBA draft class
content: From the no-brainer to the wild cards to those in between, here are eight prospects who caught Jay Bilas' eye.

title: New NBA mock draft, ahead of Wednesday's Round 1: Latest buzz on the chaotic top-10 picks
content: Will the 76ers, Hornets and Jazz take best-player-available approaches? We project both rounds of the NBA draft.

title: Our one-stop shop for the draft: Mocks, order, big questions and more
content: From teams to watch to our latest mock draft, we have everything you need to know about the 2025 draft.

title: Buzz: How Blackhawks, Isles, Predators could shake up first round
content: The first round is Friday. Our reporters pass along the latest intel they're hearing from around the league.

title: Power Rankings: Mercury overtake Liberty with five-game winning streak
content: Phoenix has bucked speculation over its new-look roster with 11 wins, including over the defending champions.

title: What the Club World Cup can tell us about comparing MLS to the Premier League and more
content: How does MLS compare to the Premier League, the Bundesliga and beyond? The Club World Cup might be the best chance to find an answer.

title: Embrace the chaos of Concacaf: 'It's a different football'
content: Every region has its quirks, but few confederations can boast the uniquely charming chaos that is Concacaf.

title: As U.S. battle without stars at Gold Cup, which fringe players are stepping up?
content: The U.S. has been without several stars at this summer's Gold Cup, so which fringe players have stepped up to fight for a place at next year's World Cup?

title: Way-Too-Early men's Bracketology: Defending champion Florida returns to the top line
content: Florida benefited from the transfer portal -- and some key NBA draft withdrawals -- to get to the top line.

title: Should you take Jeanty over Barkley in fantasy drafts?
content: Is the 2,000-yard back being undervalued? Or is regression coming for him and the hot rookie is the better choice?

title: How close is your team to an NBA title? We tiered all 30 franchises
content: While the world watched the Finals, the league's hierarchy shifted. Is OKC already looking over its shoulder ?

title: Why this Thunder big 3 might be the one to start a dynasty
content: When the Thunder set out to build a champion, they learned hard lessons from how their historic trio of KD, Russell Westbrook and James Harden flamed out a decade ago.

title: Redrafting the top 10 picks in every MLB draft from 2015 to 2024
content: Witt over Rutschman? Does Skenes still go No. 1? Let's go back in time to right the wrongs of the past 10 MLB drafts.

title: Wrexham legend Paul Mullin leaves club on loan
content: Paul Mullin, the poster boy of a Wrexham team soaring through England's football leagues following their takeover by Hollywood celebrities, has left the club to join League One side Wigan on a season-long loan deal.

title: Source: Forest in talks for Juve's Weah, Mbangula
content: Nottingham Forest are looking to Italy and have set their sights on Juventus players Timothy Weah and Samuel Mbangula to strengthen their squad this summer.

title: Alex Telles: Botafogo not in U.S. just to 'see Mickey'
content: Botafogo have defied their critics by making it to the Club World Cup last 16, with Alex Telles saying the Brazilian club proved wrong those who said they came to the U.S. just to "see Mickey."

title: Spain's Putellas: 'I'm a better Alexia now'
content: Spain's Alexia Putellas say she is a "better Alexia now" as she looks to prove a point at this summer's European Championship after missing the last one through injury.

title: Sources: Man United increase Mbeumo offer again
content: Manchester United have returned to Brentford with a renewed offer for Bryan Mbeumo, sources have told ESPN.

title: Simeone slams CWC refs: Everything 'against us'
content: Atletico Madrid will have to pick themselves up again as they pack their bags to travel back home earlier than most expected from the Club World Cup, after being knocked out of the tournament in the group stage.

title: Sources: Milan's Hernández nears Al Hilal move
content: Saudi Pro League club Al Hilal are in advanced negotiations with AC Milan to sign Theo Hernández for a fee close to €30 million ($34.6m), sources have told ESPN.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Casemiro to join Ronaldo at Al Nassr?
content: Manchester United midfielder Casemiro could be reunited with Cristiano Ronaldo at Al Nassr. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Grading the deal: Houston goes all-in, but did Phoenix get enough?
content: The Suns and Rockets have agreed to a deal that lands Kevin Durant in Houston. Which side won the trade?

title: Whitcomb, Amihere lead top pickups this week
content: Sami Whitcomb and Laeticia Amihere are positioned to produce for their teams and fantasy managers ahead of a busy week in the WNBA.

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Norman closing in on top spot at welterweight
content: Brian Norman Jr. earned his third consecutive KO win to retain the WBO welterweight title. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Jake Paul vs. Julio Cesar Chavez Jr.: How to find betting value for the fight
content: Taking Jake Paul to win doesn't offer much value, but there are other bets to consider for Saturday's bout.

title: Waiver wire: Find someone like Jo Adell?
content: Todd Zola outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire. Rumor has it you should be looking at the Angels outfield.

title: EAGLE and police officers urge students to stay away from drugs
content: EAGLE is planning awareness drives across the State to prevent drug smuggling and consumption, says official

title: Contractor hacked to death in Shiggaon
content: The assailants waylaid the victim in front of a two-wheeler showroom and attacked him with lethal weapons

title: Housing Minister should quit, BJP says and demands CBI probe into allotment ‘scam’
content: Zameer Ahmed Khan should resign for rampant corruption or the Chief Minister should immediately suspend him, says Rajkumar Telkur

title: Himachal Pradesh Bill shielding public servants from arrest without government sanction receives President’s assent
content: In the statement of objects and reasons, Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu has said that the amendment was being brought ‘to enable public servants to discharge their duties fearlessly’

title: APUWJ calls for fight against fake news
content: The keynote speakers at the seminar, presided over by APUWJ State President I.V. Subba Rao, raise awareness on artificial intelligence, social media, and the approach to deal with the false stories

title: Centre consents to transfer 1,245 acres of Salt Commission’s land to AP Maritime Board in Kakinada
content: A team of revenue officials led by Collector has taken up an exercise to assess the value of the land sought to be transferred, which is located in Kakinada city and Karapa and Tallarevu mandals

title: Election Commission orders special intensive revision of electoral rolls in poll-bound Bihar
content: The aim is to ensure that the names of all eligible citizens are included in electoral rolls to enable them to exercise their franchise

title: Kochi to host Wedding and MICE Conclave from August 14 to 16
content: Event expected to act as a B2B networking platform for the integrated development of the tourism sector in Kerala

title: Maharashtra Cabinet clears ₹20,787 crore for Shaktipeeth Expressway amid farmers’ opposition
content: Loan from HUDCO approved for land acquisition; protests continue in 12 districts over forced land survey

title: EPFO enhances auto-settlement limit for advance claims for members
content: Labour Minister Mansukh Mandaviya says the move will help lakhs of EPFO members to receive funds faster, especially in times of urgent need

title: Who won the war - Iran, Israel or US? The battle of Middle East dominance
content: Amidst a week of intense exchanges between Iran and Israel, with the US acting as both aggressor and mediator, a fragile equilibrium has emerged. While missiles flew and bases were targeted, all parties are claiming victory, signaling a desire to de-escalate and avoid further conflict. Despite the heavy costs and ongoing tensions, a path towards diplomacy is cautiously being explored.

title: 'Killed not because they knew physics but ... ': Israel kills 14 Iran scientists
content: Israel has openly acknowledged its military campaign targeting Iran's nuclear program, which involved the assassination of at least 14 senior Iranian nuclear scientists. According to Israeli officials, these individuals were directly involved in the creation and production of nuclear weapons.

title: 'Shared husband’s live location': Telangana man murdered by bride’s lover
content: A 32-year-old land surveyor from Gadwal was murdered by hired killers, allegedly orchestrated by his wife's lover. The victim, G Tejeshwar, married T Sahasra against his family's wishes a month prior. Police have arrested four suspects, including the wife and three hitmen, while the main accused, the wife's lover, remains at large

title: Nightmare! Yashasvi creates 'unwanted record'; furious Gambhir reacts
content: In the first Test against England, Yashasvi Jaiswal had a tough time with dropped catches. KL Rahul scored a composed century. Rishabh Pant blasted a quickfire ton. Their partnership helped India set a target of 371. Pant also made history as the first Indian wicketkeeper to score two centuries in a Test away from home.

title: New US Visa rule: Visa applicants to change this setting on FB, Instagram
content: The US embassy in India has announced that applicants for F, M, and J non-immigrant visas must now make their social media accounts public. This new guideline aims to help U.S. officials verify the identity and eligibility of visa applicants during the security screening process. The embassy stated this change is necessary to facilitate vetting and establish admissibility under U.S.

title: Born to shine: Diljit Dosanjh now part of Canada's Toronto Metropolitan University curriculum
content: Diljit Dosanjh's global impact is set to be explored in a new course at Toronto Metropolitan University, focusing on his cultural and musical relevance. The course, launching in late 2026, will examine his influence on global pop culture and diasporic communities. This announcement arrives amidst controversy surrounding his upcoming movie due to casting a Pakistani actress, sparking boycott calls.

title: 'Boats are sailing, cars are floating': Congress slams BJP's Gujarat model
content: Congress leader Supriya Shrinate criticized BJP's Gujarat Smart City model as heavy rain caused severe flooding in Surat. Over 400 mm of rain in 36 hours submerged roads and homes, disrupting daily life. The IMD has issued warnings for continued rainfall in Gujarat and Rajasthan, with an orange alert for eastern Rajasthan.

title: Tensions flare at Headingley! Siraj loses his cool at England openers over time-wasting drama
content: The first session of the India versus England Test saw a tense moment. Zak Crawley delayed Mohammed Siraj's over, disrupting India's plan. England's openers, Ben Duckett and Zak Crawley, batted strongly. They forged an unbeaten 117-run partnership. Bumrah missed a catch. England reached lunch at 117/0, needing 254 more runs. The match hangs in the balance with all results possible.

title: 'Elon Musk does NOT use a computer', says lawyer in court filing vs OpenAI
content: Elon Musk's lawyers asserted in court filings that he "does not use a computer," a claim contradicted by his frequent social media posts featuring laptops and confirmations from sources. This assertion is part of the ongoing lawsuit Musk's xAI filed against OpenAI, alleging breach of contract for prioritizing profit over humanity's benefit.

title: How Bill Gates reacted 'very differently' when their daughter announced her startup
content: Phoebe Gates, daughter of Bill Gates, has launched Phia, an e-commerce app co-founded with Sophia Kianni. The platform utilizes AI to compare prices across numerous websites, offering users a comprehensive view of both new and second-hand fashion items. Bill Gates initially expressed concern about potential financial requests and involvement but ultimately supported Phoebe's entrepreneurial endeavor.

title: Youth's body coated with cement & stuffed in trunk found dumped in Raipur
content: A chilling murder has rocked Raipur as authorities discovered a man's body encased in cement within a suitcase and steel trunk. Residents alerted police to a foul odor emanating from the abandoned trunk. Swift investigation led to the arrest of a lawyer, Ankit Upadhyay, and his wife at Delhi airport as they attempted to flee.

title: Diplomatic deja vu: Trump pulls off an India-Pakistan on Israel-Iran
content: US President Donald Trump unilaterally declared a ceasefire between Israel and Iran, a move that surprised even his own administration and the involved nations. Trump claimed both countries sought his intervention for peace. He outlined a detailed ceasefire plan on social media, complete with a timeline, despite ongoing missile exchanges.

title: Telangana horror: Woman killed by daughter and her boyfriend; struck with hammer
content: In Jeedimetla, a 39-year-old woman was allegedly murdered by her daughter and the daughter's boyfriend, Shiva, whom she met on Instagram. The victim had previously filed a complaint against Shiva after her daughter eloped with him. The police brought them back, but further action was pending court orders. The victim's sister alleges the pair killed her with a hammer.

title: 'Friendly plane wave': Israel defies Trump's ceasefire plan; launches missiles at Iran
content: Following a ceasefire agreement, tensions flared again between Israel and Iran, prompting US President Donald Trump to intervene. Trump assured that Israel would cease its attacks, claiming they would simply do a "Plane Wave" to Iran. Despite the ceasefire announcement, both sides accused each other of violations, with Israel citing Iranian missile fire.

title: Dwyane Wade’s daughter steals spotlight dancing in white lehanga
content: A delightful Instagram video of Kaavia James, daughter of Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union, has captured hearts globally. The six-year-old is seen joyfully dancing to the Bollywood hit “What Jhumka?” while dressed in a traditional white lehenga. The heartwarming clip, posted by her parents, celebrates cultural exploration and youthful exuberance.

title: 'No alternative to dialogue & diplomacy': India welcomes ceasefire between Israel & Iran
content: India has expressed its approval of the ceasefire between Israel and Iran, acknowledging it as a positive move amidst rising regional tensions. The Ministry of External Affairs lauded the diplomatic efforts of the United States and Qatar in facilitating the fragile truce. India reiterated that dialogue is essential for resolving regional disputes and offered support for further peacebuilding initiatives.

title: 'She’s heartbroken': Blake Lively breaks down as Taylor Swift cuts ties
content: The friendship between Blake Lively and Taylor Swift has ended. Sources say Lively is heartbroken after Swift cut ties. Legal issues involving Justin Baldoni's case add complexity. Lively must submit texts with Swift. Rumors suggest Lively tried to leverage her Swift connection. Travis Kelce supports Swift during this difficult time. Swift's upcoming album may reflect themes of betrayal.

title: 'Worn out tyres to faded runway line': DGCA audit report finds aviation lapses
content: A DGCA audit of India's aviation sector has revealed safety lapses, including worn aircraft tires, recurring defects due to ineffective repairs, and faded runway markings. The surveillance also found issues with ground handling equipment, maintenance procedures, and vehicles lacking speed governors. The DGCA has directed concerned operators to take corrective actions within seven days to address these critical findings.

title: Jammu-Srinagar tunnel: All-weather route for troops, convoys on the cards
content: In Jammu and Kashmir, the Centre is reconsidering financial approvals for the Singhpora-Vailoo and Sudhmahadev-Dranga tunnel projects to enhance year-round connectivity. These projects aim to establish a safer alternative to the Jammu-Srinagar NH 44. Additionally, the Peer Ki Gali tunnel on the Mughal Road is part of a broader initiative to provide crucial all-weather routes.

title: Bigg Boss fame Sana Khan shares an emotional post after her mother passed away
content: Sana Khan, the former Bigg Boss contestant, is mourning the loss of her mother, Mrs. Saeeda. Sana shared the heartbreaking news on social media, requesting prayers for her mother, who passed away after struggling with her health. The actress, who left the entertainment industry in 2020, had always emphasized her mother's significant role in her life and success.

title: Truce violation: Trump says 'really unhappy with Israel, not happy with Iran either'
content: Donald Trump has criticized both Israel and Iran for allegedly violating the recent ceasefire agreement. He specifically disapproved of Israel's immediate response following the truce, referencing reported airstrikes after a missile launch from Iran. While acknowledging the violations, Trump remains uncertain if the ceasefire is entirely broken.

title: Brandon Aiyuk exposes 49ers’ betrayal during injury: 'They wanted to trade me on Percs'
content: Brandon Aiyuk claims the San Francisco 49ers considered trading him. This happened while he recovered from a knee injury. Aiyuk expressed his frustration on YouTube. He signed a $120 million extension with the team. However, he feels disrespected. Aiyuk believes the 49ers are not being genuine. He wants to address the situation. The incident has created tension within the team.

title: WATCH | 'Ek taraf se Mohammad, ek taraf se Krishna': Gill's rally cry
content: Shubman Gill motivated Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna on Day 5 of the first Test. England chased 371 runs, reaching 117 at lunch without losing a wicket. Gill's remark about the bowlers was caught on the stump mic. Teams observed silence for Dilip Doshi's passing. England needed 254 more runs with all wickets in hand to win the match.

title: Udaipur shocker: French tourist sexually assaulted; FIR filed, accused flees
content: In Udaipur's Tiger Hill area, a French tourist reported a sexual assault after visiting a local café. Following a visit to The Greek Farm café, the victim allegedly left with a man named Siddharth, who is accused of taking her to his room and committing the assault.

title: SCO summit in China: Ajit Doval urges nations to 'shun double standards against terrorism'
content: NSA Ajit Doval addressed the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation, urging members to abandon double standards in combating terrorism and hold accountable those responsible for cross-border attacks. He highlighted India's concern over UN-proscribed terror groups and advocated for a joint information operation to counter terrorism, separatism, and extremism within the SCO framework.

title: Air India to resume Middle East, Europe flights; US, Canada operations next
content: Air India announced the gradual resumption of flights to West Asia as airspace reopens in the conflict-hit region, with most Middle East operations restarting from June 25. Flights to and from Europe are being reinstated, while services to the US East Coast and Canada will resume soon. The airline is committed to minimising disruptions and avoiding unsafe airspaces.

title: Top 5 entertainment news: FWICE vs Diljit’s Sardaarji 3, Govinda on turning down Avatar
content: Sunita Ahuja refutes Govinda's Avatar claim. Izabelle Leite recalls dating Virat Kohli. Salman Khan shares Kareena Kapoor's childhood fandom. Karisma Kapoor attends ex-husband's prayer meet with her children. FWICE seeks boycott of Diljit Dosanjh and 'Sardaarji 3' makers for casting Hania Aamir. The federation has also requested that their passports be revoked. The article covers a range of entertainment news.

title: Tata Harrier EV RWD vs Hyundai Creta EV: Price, variants, specs compared
content: Talking about the range, the Harrier EV’s 75kWh RWD and AWD versions offer an MIDC-certified range of up to 627km and 622km, respectively, on a full charge. Talking about the charging, the SUV takes approximately 10.7 hours to go from 10 to 100 per cent using a 7.2kW AC charger, while a 120kW DC fast charger can top up the battery from 20 to 80 per cent in just 25 minutes (both claimed).

title: 'Virat Kohli felt it was time to go': Sourav Ganguly drops bombshell on his shocking Test retirement
content: Sourav Ganguly confirmed Virat Kohli's Test retirement was his own decision, despite BCCI's attempts to persuade him otherwise. Ganguly acknowledged Kohli's choice, drawing parallels to his own retirement, emphasizing that every player understands their standing. While surprised by Kohli's relatively early departure at 36, Ganguly believes Kohli felt it was the right time, similar to his own exit.

title: 'They are not Bangladeshis': Mamata says Bengal migrants wrongfully held
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee claims Bengali workers are wrongly identified as Bangladeshis and deported. She accuses the BJP of language-based politics. Banerjee says her government has rescued some workers. Recent crackdowns in Delhi saw the arrest of suspected illegal immigrants. Banerjee previously accused the BSF of aiding infiltration.

title: Watch: Fire erupts in Moscow apartment after Ukrainian drone strike
content: A Ukrainian drone strike ignited a fire in a multi-storey building in Krasnogorsk, Moscow, injuring two and prompting the evacuation of over 100 residents, including 30 children. Russia's defence ministry reported destroying 20 Ukrainian drones across six regions, leading to temporary flight suspensions at Moscow's Vnukovo and Sheremetyevo airports.

title: Bold statement! 'Rishabh Pant could break Rahul Dravid's record'
content: Rishabh Pant's twin centuries in the Leeds Test have sparked discussions about his potential to surpass Rahul Dravid's record for most Test centuries by an Indian in England. Sanjay Manjrekar highlighted Pant's unique position as a wicketkeeper-batter, praising his adaptability and aggressive yet measured approach.

title: 'Vote theft': Rahul Gandhi alleges voter list manipulation in Fadnavis' constituency
content: Rahul Gandhi has accused Devendra Fadnavis' constituency of voter list irregularities, alleging an eight per cent increase in five months and unauthorized voting. Gandhi shared a news article on X, calling for the release of digital voter rolls and CCTV footage. He claims the Election Commission is silent or complicit, labeling the situation as "vote theft".

title: Rashtrapati Bhavan: Siddaramaiah-Aamir Khan candid pics go viral
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and Bollywood actor Aamir Khan exchanged warm greetings at Rashtrapati Bhavan on Tuesday, capturing the internet's attention. The spontaneous interaction was described as friendly, with both exchanging best wishes. Siddaramaiah is in Delhi for official engagements, including a meeting with Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

title: Black box of crashed AI plane not sent abroad, says Naidu; currently with AIIB
content: Civil Aviation Minister K Rammohan Naidu refuted media reports claiming the Air India Ahmedabad crash black box was sent abroad. He confirmed the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) is analyzing it in India. The London-bound Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner crashed on June 12, killing 241, and the government formed a panel to investigate the cause.

title: US strike on Iran: Mystery deepens over missing uranium stockpile; buried or moved?
content: Satellite images and Israeli intelligence suggest Iran moved near-weapons-grade uranium before US airstrikes on its nuclear facilities. The missing fuel, enough for multiple bombs, raises concerns despite claims of program obliteration. While the strikes caused significant damage, the location of the enriched uranium remains unknown, hindering diplomatic efforts and potentially delaying Iran's nuclear ambitions.

title: 'All polls held as per law': EC rebuts Rahul; LoP repeats 'voter theft' charge
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) refuted Rahul Gandhi's rigging allegations in the 2024 Maharashtra polls, asserting adherence to established electoral laws and processes. Despite ECI's clarification and invitation for further discussion, Gandhi persisted with his claims of irregularities, particularly highlighting significant voter list increases in certain constituencies and demanding the release of digital voter rolls and CCTV footage.

title: ITR filing last date extended: Will penal interest be charged after July 31? What experts say
content: The ITR filing deadline for FY 2024-25 has been extended to September 15, 2025, potentially waiving penal interest under Section 234A if self-assessment tax is paid by the extended date. However, this extension does not affect penal interest applicability under Sections 234B and 234C for advance tax deficiencies, which remain in effect.

title: TCS plans big Rs 4,500 crore push: New campuses, office spaces & more
content: Tata Consultancy Services is investing heavily in expansion. New campuses and office spaces are planned across India. Bengaluru, Kolkata, and Kochi are key locations. The company aims to boost delivery capacity. This move signals confidence in India's tech talent. TCS reported strong financial results for FY25. Headcount also increased with new hires and promotions.

title: Peace in Our Timeline? How Trump keeps declaring ceasefires — and craving credit
content: Because in Trump’s world, peace isn’t negotiated—it’s declared. Ceasefires aren’t forged in backrooms or brokered by diplomats. They’re conjured on​Truth Social and announced as if the world runs on vibes. It’s not diplomacy. It’s delusion dressed in digital drag.

title: Centre ready to set up nuclear power plant in Bihar: Manohar Lal Khattar
content: The plant will be set up as part of the Centre’s plan to establish six Small Modular Reactors (SMRs) across the country, the Energy Minister says, while assuring support for the State government in setting up the plant

title: Punkunnam-Puzhakkal road closure for repairs leads to traffic chaos in Thrissur
content: Unless two-way access is restored on the stretch, the traffic bottlenecks across Ayyanthole, Kurinjyakkal, and Puzhakkal will only worsen

title: Airspace restrictions in West Asia drive airfares up
content: Air India Express said that it was progressively resuming its operations to West Asia from Tuesday as airspaces in the region reopen.

title: Teach lessons about Emergency in schools: Governor Arlekar
content: He says it is up to the government to decide whether to include content on the constitutional role of Governors in the syllabus. He, however, stresses the need to prioritise the history of Emergency

title: Shun double standards in combating terroism: NSA Doval at SCO meet in China
content: The NSA specifically called on SCO member states to hold accountable the perpetrators, organisers, financiers and sponsors of acts of cross-border terror and to help bring them to justice

title: Shoukath’s Panakkad visit marks shift in IUML-Congress dynamics
content: Despite decades of partnership, the Congress and IUML have had a strained relationship, particularly in Malappuram district. Historical unease between the two key UDF constituents, fuelled by scepticism among some veteran Congress leaders towards the IUML, had led to friction and even electoral clashes in several panchayats. This even required the UDF leadership to intervene and mediate in the past

title: India stands ready to help resolve conflict: MEA on West Asia situation
content: New Delhi said it remained "deeply concerned" about the overall situation, but welcomed reports of a ceasefire between Iran and Israel

title: Munnar grasslands go to seed for want of follow-up action
content: During 2018-21, the Forest department had implemented an eco-restoration project and cleared exotic plants on 60 hectares of forest land at Gundumala in Idukki. Now, lack of follow-up action and monitoring have resulted in invasive plants gaining ground once again here

title: Tourism stakeholders welcome Minister’s promise to start Munnar flyover work soon
content: Though the State Budget in 2016 allocated ₹38 crore for construction of flyover, work has not yet begun. Hill station witnesses hours-long traffic block during weekends and holidays

title: Tenders for development of Vijayawada railway station will be called within 15 days, says MP
content: Soon, flights will be launched from Vijayawada to Varanasi, Goa, Pune, Ahmedabad and Cochin, says Kesineni Sivanath at a meeting organised on the occasion of completion of one year as MP

title: Congress distances itself from Tharoor’s comments on Modi
content: The party cites U.S. advisory for its citizens travelling to India as example of foreign policy “falling flat”

title: Watch: Why Kailash Manasarovar Yatra is an important event for India-China relations
content: Preview of the Kailash Manasarovar Yatra and why it’s an important step in ‘normalising’ India-China ties after LAC tensions

title: Operation Sindoor showed the world India’s uncompromising policy against terrorism: PM
content: Indian forces compelled the “enemy to surrender within 22 minutes using domestically manufactured weapons,” says PM; adds that “Made-in-India” weapons will soon earn global recognition, acclaim

title: Madhya Pradesh man held for ‘selling’ wife to friend to pay off a debt
content: The woman has alleged that her husband forced her to have physical relations with his friend, and she was raped in Indore and Delhi

title: IND vs ENG: Why are India, England players wearing black armbands? Full details
content: Indian and England cricket players wore black armbands on Day 5 of the first Test at Headingley to pay tribute to Dilip Doshi, the former Indian spinner. Doshi, who passed away at the age of 77 in London due to a cardiac arrest, was remembered for his determination and contributions to Indian cricket despite playing alongside Bishan Singh Bedi.

title: 8-hour ordeal: Leaky Vande Bharat train roof leaves student drenched; staff say ‘adjust kariye’
content: Darshil Mishra's Vande Bharat Express journey from Varanasi to Delhi turned disastrous when the train's roof leaked, drenching him and fellow passengers. The onboard staff's dismissive response and the TTE's absence compounded the issue, forcing passengers to endure a humid and uncomfortable ride. The incident, captured on video, sparked outrage online, prompting calls for accountability and improved maintenance.

title: Over 3,000 police personnel to be deployed for Chief Minister’s visit in Vellore, Tirupattur
content: Mr. Stalin will inaugurate Government Pentland Hospital which has been refurbished into a multi-super specialty hospital

title: DGCA finds multiple violations related to airlines, airports, aircraft maintenance works
content: Without disclosing names of the airlines, airports and other entities in relation to the defects, DGCA said surveillance covered multiple critical areas such as flight operations, airworthiness, ramp safety, Air Traffic Control, Communication, Navigation and Surveillance systems, and pre-flight medical evaluations

title: 11,500 cusecs of water released to boost Kharif operations in Godavari delta
content: Paddy farmers have intensified direct sowing and nursery activities marking the beginning of the Kharif season 2025-26 in the Godavari region

title: Thrissur becomes first district to convert tribal settlements with individual forest rights into revenue villages
content: Collector hands over notification declaring Kakkinikkad settlement in Thekkumkara panchayat as a revenue village to the Oorumooppan. 36 forest villages across Talappilly, Thrissur, and Chalakudy taluks have been granted individual forest rights

title: Unaccounted cash row: Parliamentary panel asks why no FIR against Justice Varma
content: During a meeting of the Parliamentary Committee on Personnel, Public Grievances, Law and Justice, MPs of various parties raised the issue and posed several questions to the Ministry of Law and Justice on what it was doing in the matters raised concerning the judiciary

title: Karnataka Housing Minister Zameer Ahmed Khan says he will order a probe into allegations of corruption in allotment of houses
content: ‘I am not a poor man who survives by taking bribe for sanctioning houses meant for underprivileged sections’, says Housing Minister

title: Free Sparsha Darshan to resume at Srisailam temple from July 1
content: The facility will be available for two hours— 1.45 p.m. to 3.45 p.m.—on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Thursdays and Fridays, says temple Executive Officer

title: French woman raped in Udaipur, police looking for accused
content: “The woman is allegedly in a stable condition and is undergoing treatment at a private hospital,” Station House Officer added

title: Giving wings to Wayanad’s airstrip dreams, feasibility study to get under way
content: Inability to identify a suitable piece of land, at least 1,800 m in length, in the hilly district remains one of the major hurdles. KIIFCON-RITES is conducting study in Idukki and Kasaragod districts as well

title: How Indian-Origin Engineer, Who Worked On B-2 Stealth Bombers, Spied For China
content: The B-2 Spirit stealth bombers, the world's most advanced aircraft, were used by the US in its Operation Midnight Hammer on Sunday to dismantle Iran's nuclear facilities amid Israeli claims that Tehran was on the verge of acquiring a nuclear weapon.

title: Poll Body To Begin Special Intensive Revision Of Electoral Rolls In Bihar
content: The Election Commission on Monday issued instructions to carry out a Special Intensive Revision in Bihar to weed out ineligible names and ensure all eligible citizens are included in the electoral roll, allowing them to exercise their franchise in th

title: Rajnath Singh Authorises Defence Chief To Issue Orders To 3 Services
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has authorised Chief of Defence Staff Gen Anil Chauhan to issue orders to the three services to ensure greater synergy.

title: Delhi High Court Allows Actor Rajpal Yadav To Travel To Australia
content: The Delhi High Court has allowed actor Rajpal Yadav's plea to travel to Melbourne, Australia between June 27 and July 5 for the promotion of upcoming film "Mera Kale Rang Da Yaar".

title: 241 On Board, 34 On Ground: Official Tally Of Deaths In Air India Crash
content: 275 people died in June 12 Air India Crash, 241 on board, 34 on the ground: Gujarat health department

title: "No Alternative To Dialogue, Diplomacy": India On Iran-Israel Ceasefire
content: Hours after US President Donald Trump's claims of an Iran-Israel ceasefire, India on Tuesday said it stands ready to play its part to resolve the situation and insisted on "dialogue and diplomacy" as the way forward.

title: Indian Student In UK Breaks Into Woman's Room, Masturbates On Bed, Toys
content: An Indian civil engineering student at Northumbria University in the UK has received a prison sentence after breaking into a fellow undergraduate's room and masturbating on her bed and belongings.

title: Read Full Text Of Gautam Adani's Speech At Adani AGM 2025
content: Gautam Adani, the Chairman of the Adani Group, today praised the Indian Armed Forces for successfully performing 'Operation Sindoor' while addressing the Adani Enterprises' Annual General Meeting (AGM).

title: 5 Dead After Inhaling Poisonous Gas In Well In Madhya Pradesh's Guna
content: Five persons died due to suspected inhalation of poisonous gas after they descended into a well to rescue a calf in Guna district of Madhya Pradesh on Tuesday, officials said.

title: Israel-Iran War LIVE Updates: Iran President Says Will Respect Ceasefire If Israel Does
content: US-Israel-Iran Conflict LIVE Updates: A series of powerful explosions rocked Tehran early Tuesday morning, hours after US President Donald Trump announced that Iran and Israel have agreed to a staggered ceasefire.

title: 'Reported Defects Reappearing On Aircraft': Aviation Watchdog After Audit
content: A special audit of airlines, maintenance teams and other aspects carried out by the aviation watchdog at airports like Delhi and Mumbai has revealed several deficiencies, including reported defects reappearing on aircraft.

title: Amit Shah Chairs Central Zonal Council Meet in Varanasi
content: A meeting of the Central Zonal Council, chaired by the Union Home Minister Amit Shah, discussed regional law and order, border security, disaster response and environmental protection with chief ministers and senior officials of four states on Tuesda

title: "All Planes Will Head Home": Trump, Unhappy With Israel, Dials Netanyahu
content: The ceasefire between Iran and Israel "is in effect" and Israel is not going to attack Iran, Donald Trump declared on Tuesday amid fears that the tenous ceasefire agreement between Iran and Israel will not hold.

title: Zelensky, Trump Set To Meet Wednesday On NATO Sidelines, Ukraine Confirms
content: Volodymyr Zelensky and US President Donald Trump are planning to meet on Wednesday on the sidelines of the NATO summit in The Hague, a senior source in the Ukrainian presidency told AFP.

title: Tirupati Laddoos Now Available At Easy-To-Use Kiosks For Pilgrims
content: The Tirupati laddoo that has a dedicated following of its own, even among those who may not identify themselves as devotees, is now available at kiosk machines set up at laddoos counters in Tirumala.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Between Operations Gibraltar And Sindoor, A Missed Industrial Revolution
content: A look at some numbers to see how far India has travelled over the last sixty years, since Operation Gibraltar of 1965.

title: Trump Tells Israel 'Don't Drop Bombs,' Then Drops An F-Bomb
content: US President Donald Trump was clearly unhappy with Israel and Iran when he left the White House earlier today for the NATO summit at The Hague.

title: "1.4 Billion Hearts Beat For Indian Astronaut's Space Journey": Top Official
content: India's second astronaut, Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, is poised to make history as he prepares to fly to the International Space Station aboard the Axiom-4 mission, also known as Mission Akash Ganga.

title: 5 Weapons Kept 'Secret' So Far Were Deployed By US During Iran Strikes
content: Five weapons, apart from the Tomahawk cruise missiles and the GBU-57 bunker-buster bombs, no one knew about till now, were also deployed by the US for its mission to strike Iran's three nuclear sites - Fordow, Natanz and Eshafan.

title: Taken Measures To Continue Nuclear Programme Post US-Israeli Strikes, Iran Says
content: Iran's government said Tuesday it had "taken the necessary measures" to ensure the continuation of its nuclear programme after US and Israeli strikes targeted its facilities.

title: Final draft rankings: Schaefer, Misa, Hagens, then...?
content: the top 64 are ranked here, along with details of their game, areas for development, perception among NHL scouts and an NHL projection . some players grade at higher or lower value than in previous rankings, but their position considers how likely they are to become NHL players based on their developmental needs and perception .

title: 🔮 Way-Too-Early NBA Power Rankings
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder are crowned the new champions of the league . the 2024-25 season has officially come to a close . our writers reflect on what to expect this offseason and put down the groundwork for what should be another competitive, unpredictable, 2025-26 season .

title: NBA free agency 2025: Latest signings, news, buzz, reports
content: Shams Charania tells pat McAfee he hasn't heard any rumors around LaMelo Ball . the Hornets shouldn't discount moving him if a massive offer comes along . teams around the league are keeping an eye on former MVP Giannis Antetokounmpo and his future with the Milwaukee Bucks .

title: First-team reps? Big plays? A sneak peek at how the 2025 NFL draft first-rounders look
content: rookies across the league have had their chance to make their first impressions . there were 32 first-round picks from the 2025 draft . a group of rookie pass catchers came to the building at 5 a.m. .

title: Jon Jones operated on his terms, even in announcing his retirement
content: david frum: the retirement news of arguably the greatest mixed martial artist of all time was underwhelming . he says he was let down by the man he recently called the best pound-for-pound fighter in the world . his retirement squashed a highly anticipated heavyweight title unification fight between Jones and iraq . frum says it's not the end of Jones' complicated career .

title: Which Finals stars made our top five?
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder have been crowned NBA champions for the first time since arriving in the Sooner State 17 years ago . the NHL handles its postseason honors that way, with the Conn Smythe Trophy awarded to the player with the best overall postseason . we set out to fill that gap with our five-player MVP ballot .

title: Jones known for being great, not fighting Tom Aspinall
content: Dana White announces Jon Jones' retirement from the UFC . he declares Tom Aspinall the new heavyweight champion . "Jon Jones called us last night and retired," he tells a group of reporters . the 37-year-old has retired from mixed martial arts .

title: MMA World Power Index: Eight countries represented at UFC 317
content: MMA is a true example of an international sport . 10 countries are represented among the 17 divisional champions . 26 fighters from eight nations capping off the UFC's international Fight Week . the voting criteria were based on four factors: current champions, ranked fighters across all divisi .

title: White Sox give minors deal to righty Syndergaard
content: Noah Syndergaard has signed a minor league deal with the Chicago White Sox . he hasn't pitched in the majors since 2023, when he appeared in 18 games split between the Los Angeles Dodgers and Cleveland Guardians . the 32-year-old has a career 3.71 ERA over the course of eight seasons .

title: Another Red Sox star on the move? A former Cy Young winner? Ranking the top 50 MLB trade deadline candidates
content: Xavier Scruggs names the players he believes could be up for grabs at the trade deadline . some of the players on the list are unlikely to be dealt but at least are being discussed in potential deals . players are ranked by value for their new team, not likelihood of being dealt .

title: MCWS 2025: What it means for LSU, favorite moments, 2026 predictions
content: the 2025 MCWS broke away from last year's SEC/ACC takeover . the tournament was the 75th anniversary of the men's college world series in Omaha, Nebraska . analysts share their favorite moments from the tournament and offer predictions for 2026 .
